verses.text_plain: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good.
verses.verse_html:
1The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity: there is none that doeth good. ▼
▼ Maschil: or, of instruction

tokens.definition: לֵב lêb, labe; a form of H3824 ; the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything:—care for, comfortably, consent, × considered, courag(-eous), friend(-ly), ((broken-), (hard-), (merry-), (stiff-), (stout-), double) heart(-ed), × heed, × I, kindly, midst, mind(-ed), × regard(-ed), × themselves, × unawares, understanding, × well, willingly, wisdom. Note by BLB: Strong's entry lists the pronunciation of this word with the "b" sound. This is incorrect. The ב (bet) does not have a daghesh lene so it is pronounced with a "v" sound. This is why the transliteration has a bar under the "b" (ḇ).
tokens.kjv_translation_count: heart (508x), mind (12x), midst (11x), understanding (10x), hearted (7x), wisdom (6x), comfortably (4x), well (4x), considered (2x), friendly (2x), kindly (2x), stouthearted (with H 47) (2x), care (with H 7760) (2x), misc 21 .
outline: inner man, mind, will, heart, understanding inner part, midst midst (of things) heart (of man) soul, heart (of man) mind, knowledge, thinking, reflection, memory inclination, resolution, determination (of will) conscience heart (of moral character) as seat of appetites as seat of emotions and passions as seat of courage

verses.text_plain: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.
verses.verse_html: 2God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.

verses.text_plain: Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
verses.verse_html: 3Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

verses.text_plain: There were they in great fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee: thou hast put them to shame, because God hath despised them.

5There were they in great fear, where no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee: thou hast put them to shame, because God hath despised them. ▼
▼ were…: Heb. they feared a fear

tokens.definition: שׁוּב shûwb, shoob; a primitive root; to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again:—((break, build, circumcise, dig, do anything, do evil, feed, lay down, lie down, lodge, make, rejoice, send, take, weep)) × again, (cause to) answer ( again), × in any case (wise), × at all, averse, bring (again, back, home again), call (to mind), carry again (back), cease, × certainly, come again (back), × consider, continually, convert, deliver (again), deny, draw back, fetch home again, × fro, get (oneself) (back) again, × give (again), go again (back, home), (go) out, hinder, let, (see) more, × needs, be past, × pay, pervert, pull in again, put (again, up again), recall, recompense, recover, refresh, relieve, render (again), requite, rescue, restore, retrieve, (cause to, make to) return, reverse, reward, say nay, send back, set again, slide back, still, × surely, take back (off), (cause to, make to) turn (again, self again, away, back, back again, backward, from, off), withdraw.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: return (391x), ...again (248x), turn (123x), ...back (65x), ...away (56x), restore (39x), bring (34x), render (19x), answer (18x), recompense (8x), recover (6x), deliver (5x), put (5x), withdraw (5x), requite (4x), miscellaneous (40x).
outline: to return, turn back (Qal) to turn back, return to turn back to return, come or go back to return unto, go back, come back of dying of human relations (fig) of spiritual relations (fig) to turn back (from God), apostatise to turn away (of God) to turn back (to God), repent turn back (from evil) of inanimate things in repetition (Polel) to bring back to restore, refresh, repair (fig) to lead away (enticingly) to show turning, apostatise (Pual) restored (participle) (Hiphil) to cause to return, bring back to bring back, allow to return, put back, draw back, give back, restore, relinquish, give in payment to bring back, refresh, restore to bring back, report to, answer to bring back, make requital, pay (as recompense) to turn back or backward, repel, defeat, repulse, hinder, reject, refuse to turn away (face), turn toward to turn against to bring back to mind to show a turning away to reverse, revoke (Hophal) to be returned, be restored, be brought back (Pulal) brought back

tokens.definition: שְׁבוּת shᵉbûwth, sheb-ooth'; or שְׁבִית shᵉbîyth; from H7617 ; exile, concretely, prisoners; figuratively, a former state of prosperity:—captive(-ity).
tokens.kjv_translation_count: captivity (31x), captives (1x), variant (11x), Strong's synonym (1x).

tokens.definition: עַם ʻam, am; from H6004 ; a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock:—folk, men, nation, people.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: people (1,: 836x), nation (17x), people (with H 1121) (4x), folk (2x), Ammi (1x), men (1x), each (1x).
outline: nation, people people, nation persons, members of one's people, compatriots, country-men
persons, members of one's people, compatriots, country-men

tokens.definition: יַעֲקֹב Yaʻăqôb, yah-ak-obe'; from H6117 ; heel-catcher (i.e. supplanter); Jaakob, the Israelitish patriarch:—Jacob.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: Jacob (349x).
outline: Jacob = "heel holder" or "supplanter" son of Isaac, grandson of Abraham, and father of the 12 patriarchs of the tribes of Israel
son of Isaac, grandson of Abraham, and father of the 12 patriarchs of the tribes of Israel

tokens.definition: גִּיל gîyl, gheel; or (by permutation) גּוּל gûwl; a primitive root; properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear:—be glad, joy, be joyful, rejoice.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: rejoice (27x), glad (10x), joyful (4x), joy (2x), delight (1x).
outline: to rejoice, exult, be glad (Qal) to rejoice to tremble (from fear)

tokens.definition: יִשְׂרָאֵל Yisrâʼêl, yis-raw-ale'; from H8280 and H410 ; he will rule as God; Jisraël, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity:—Israel.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: Israel (2,: 489x), Israelites (16x).

tokens.definition: שָׂמַח sâmach, saw-makh'; a primitive root; probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome:—cheer up, be (make) glad, (have, make) joy(-ful), be (make) merry, (cause to, make to) rejoice, × very.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: rejoice (95x), glad (45x), joy (5x), joyful (2x), merry (2x), miscellaneous (3x).
